title: Sticky Chinese pork
time: Hands-on time 10 mins, 15 mins cooking time, plus marinating
description: This super-quick sticky Chinese pork recipe brings Chinese flavours to the table but is cheaper and healthier than your Saturday night takeaway.
ingredients: 3 tbsp light soy sauce, plus extra to serve

method.Step 1: Place the pork in a bowl with the soy sauce, sesame oil, five spice, garlic, ginger and honey. Toss together and set aside for 10 minutes.

method.Step 2: Heat half the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add the pork with a slotted spoon and fry until almost cooked. Add the marinade and bubble for 5 minutes until sticky.

method.Step 3: Meanwhile, in a separate wok or frying pan, heat the remaining oil and stir-fry the pepper and mangetout with a splash of water for a few minutes. Add the pak choi and cook for a further minute, then stir in the beansprouts. Toss with the pork, drizzle with soy sauce, sprinkle with the sesame seeds and serve.
